政治家必须有开创精神.

sentences.en: A statesman should be animated by lofty sentiments.
sentences.cn: 政治家应当焕发出崇高的情操.

sentences.en: Friends gathered at a memorial for the late statesman.
sentences.cn: 这位已故政治家的生前好友为他举行了纪念仪式.

sentences.en: Hamilton is a great statesman and political thinker.
sentences.cn: 汉密尔顿是个伟大的政治家和政治思想家。

sentences.en: He approaches to the character of the ablest statesman.
sentences.cn: 他具有近乎最能干的政治家的品质.

sentences.en: He has written eight books and has cultivated the image of an elder statesman.
sentences.cn: 他已经写了8本书，树立起了其政界元老的形象。

sentences.en: He was acknowledged as an able statesman.
sentences.cn: 他被公认为是个有才干的政治家.

sentences.en: He was in his late eighties and had become the country's most respected elder statesman.
sentences.cn: 他年近九旬，已成为该国最受尊崇的政界元老。

sentences.en: His reputation as a statesman is splendid.
sentences.cn: 作为政治家,他的名声极好.

sentences.en: Is he anything of a statesman?
It required a statesman's foresight and sagacity to make the decision.
sentences.cn: 作出这个决定需要政治家的远见卓识.

sentences.en: She then wrote an extremely irate letter to the New Statesman about me.
sentences.cn: 她接着给《新政治家》杂志写了一封关于我的信，言辞极其激烈。

sentences.en: The statesman is much occupied with affairs of state.
The university conferred its highest degree on the statesman.
sentences.cn: 该大学将其最高学位授予了这位政治家.
